Azurepaw Foxbrew.name: Azurepaw Foxbrew
Azurepaw Foxbrew.description:
Activate 1 interact

Devised by the Azurepaw Silvertail tribe, this foxbrew opens one's mind to the power of the stars; whether tea or rice wine, both are mixed with Numerian fluids for an out-of-this-world kick that often prevents worse of the fluids' effects. After the tea is consumed, if the drinker imbibes Numerian fluids within the next [[/r 2d4+1 #Hours]]{2d4+1 hours}, they can choose to replace the effects of those fluids (as well as any addition suffered) with the following: your hair, fur, or similar dermal becomes bright blue. This doesn't change your current pigmentation, but alters future growth. After this effect ends, you are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Stupefied]{Stupefied 2} for [[/r 2d4+1 #Hours]]{2d4+1 hours} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Fatigued]{Fatigued}.

Babble Foxbrew.name: Babble Foxbrew
Babble Foxbrew.description:
Activate 1 interact

Favored by kitsune communities that live primarily in their fox forms, this brew tastes strongly of greens; teas blend jasmine and mint while rice wine is mixed with fermented grass. After the tea is consumed, you gain the ability to talk while using Change Shape to assume a form that is normally incapable of speech, such as your fox form or a noh mask of animal shapes's animal form. This effect lasts [[/r 2d4+1 #Hours]]{2d4+1 hours}. When the effect ends, you are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Stupefied]{Stupefied 2} for [[/r 2d4+1 #Hours]]{2d4+1 hours} and take a -2 status penalty to all linguistic actions.

Bright Grains Foxbrew.name: Bright Grains Foxbrew
Bright Grains Foxbrew.description:
Activate 1 interact

Named for the mythological servitors of Daikitsu, this hardy brew has a rich taste that literally puts fur on one's chest; teas blend green tea herbs with peppermint and cinnamon while rice wine is mixed with malt beer. Over the next 10 minutes after the tea is consumed, you transform into a kitsune of the same age and body type with roughly analogous physical traits. As a kitsune, you gain the kitsune trait, low-light vision, and the Change Shape action, which you can use to return to their true form. If you were already a kitsune, you are reverted back to your true form if you were in an alternate form and you gain a random 1st level kitsune ancestry feat you didn't already have. This effect lasts [[/r 2d4+1 #Hours]]{2d4+1 hours}. When the effect ends, you are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Sickened]{Sickened 1} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Stupefied]{Stupefied 2} for 2d4+1 hours. Every [[/r 2d4 #Rounds]]{2d4 rounds}, your sickened condition's value increases by 1; if you aren't sickened, you become sickened 1. You can Retch (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:20] save) by hiccuping loudly.

Bubbly Foxbrew.name: Bubbly Foxbrew
Bubbly Foxbrew.description:
Activate 1 interact

Possessing a light taste that tickles the tongue, bubbly foxbrew often has a hint of sweetness; teas and rice wine both make heavy use of boba starch, giving the drink its trademark bubbles. 10 minutes after you consume the tea, you gain the benefits of an @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.b5sGjGlBf58f8jn0]{Air Walk} spell for [[/r 2d4+1 #Hours]]{2d4+1 hours}, during which you reduce all falling damage you take by half and take a -4 penalty to AC, to Acrobatics and Athletics checks against wind, and to saves against effects that forcibly move you, such as @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Shove]{Shove}, or knock you @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Prone]{Prone}, such as @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Trip]{Trip}.

Ever-Burning Foxfire.name: Ever-Burning Foxfire
Ever-Burning Foxfire.description:
When etched with this rune, the handwraps manifest a detailed family history when worn by a kitsune, written in their ancestor's hand. If you use the rune to assume a fox form, the handwraps adjust to your new form rather than merging with it, wrapping around your front paws or transforming into a scarf or bow (your choice).

Activate 1 envision

Requirement You have a foxfire unarmed attack

Effect If your next action is to Change Shape, you retain the benefits of your Foxfire and Foxfire Adept Dedication feats, as well as all feats that list either feat as a prerequisite, while assuming your new form.

Foxfire Lantern.name: Foxfire Lantern
Foxfire Lantern.description:
Requirements Foxfire

Available in a multitude of styles, a foxfire lantern is a tool for storing a kitsune's foxfire. While Invested, an ember of your foxfire smolders within the foxfire lantern, producing dim light in a 5-foot area. Your investiture ends when a creature uses a single action to Interact with the foxfire lantern, opening it and allowing your foxfire to escape and instantly return to you.

Activate 1 envision (concentrate, divine, evocation)

Effect The foxfire ember ignites into a cheery flame identical to that of the invested creature's Foxfire, shedding light as a @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Light} cantrip, heightened to half the invested character's level. Additionally, anyone holding the item gains a foxfire unarmed attack, as the Foxfire kitsune ancestry feat, as well as the benefits of all ancestry feats the invested character has that list Foxfire or Foxfire Adept Dedication as a prerequisite that are of a level equal to your level or the invested character's level, whichever is lower. You can use the hand that you're using to hold the foxfire lantern to Strike with this foxfire unarmed strike.

Foxfire Lantern (Cloaked, Disguise).name: Foxfire Lantern (Cloaked, Disguise)
Foxfire Lantern (Cloaked, Disguise).description:
Requirements Foxfire

Available in a multitude of styles, a foxfire lantern is a tool for storing a kitsune's foxfire. While Invested, an ember of your foxfire smolders within the foxfire lantern, producing dim light in a 5-foot area. Your investiture ends when a creature uses a single action to Interact with the foxfire lantern, opening it and allowing your foxfire to escape and instantly return to you.

While invested with Foxfire, you can activate the lantern to change your appearance.

Activate 1 envision (concentrate, divine, illusion)

Requirements The veiled foxfire lantern is producing light as a light cantrip

Frequency once per day

Effect The creature holding the lantern changes appearance, as an @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.i35dpZFI7jZcRoBo]{Illusory Disguise} divine spell with a spell level equal to half the invested character's level (minimum 1st level).

Activate 1 envision (concentrate, divine, evocation)

Effect The foxfire ember ignites into a cheery flame identical to that of the invested creature's Foxfire, shedding light as a @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Light} cantrip, heightened to half the invested character's level. Additionally, anyone holding the item gains a foxfire unarmed attack, as the Foxfire kitsune ancestry feat, as well as the benefits of all ancestry feats the invested character has that list Foxfire or Foxfire Adept Dedication as a prerequisite that are of a level equal to your level or the invested character's level, whichever is lower. You can use the hand that you're using to hold the foxfire lantern to Strike with this foxfire unarmed strike.

Foxfire Lantern (Cloaked, Invisibility).name: Foxfire Lantern (Cloaked, Invisibility)
Foxfire Lantern (Cloaked, Invisibility).description:
Requirements Foxfire

Available in a multitude of styles, a foxfire lantern is a tool for storing a kitsune's foxfire. While Invested, an ember of your foxfire smolders within the foxfire lantern, producing dim light in a 5-foot area. Your investiture ends when a creature uses a single action to Interact with the foxfire lantern, opening it and allowing your foxfire to escape and instantly return to you.

While invested with Foxfire, you can activate the lantern to become invisible.

Activate 1 envision (concentrate, divine, illusion)

Requirements The veiled foxfire lantern is producing light as a light cantrip

Frequency once per day

Effect The creature holding the lantern becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}, as a @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.XXqE1eY3w3z6xJCB]{Invisibility} divine spell with a spell level equal to half the invested character's level (minimum 2nd level).

Activate 1 envision (concentrate, divine, evocation)

Effect The foxfire ember ignites into a cheery flame identical to that of the invested creature's Foxfire, shedding light as a @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Light} cantrip, heightened to half the invested character's level. Additionally, anyone holding the item gains a foxfire unarmed attack, as the Foxfire kitsune ancestry feat, as well as the benefits of all ancestry feats the invested character has that list Foxfire or Foxfire Adept Dedication as a prerequisite that are of a level equal to your level or the invested character's level, whichever is lower. You can use the hand that you're using to hold the foxfire lantern to Strike with this foxfire unarmed strike.

Foxfire Lantern (Formcage).name: Foxfire Lantern (Formcage)
Foxfire Lantern (Formcage).description:
Requirements Foxfire

Available in a multitude of styles, a foxfire lantern is a tool for storing a kitsune's foxfire. While Invested, an ember of your foxfire smolders within the foxfire lantern, producing dim light in a 5-foot area. Your investiture ends when a creature uses a single action to Interact with the foxfire lantern, opening it and allowing your foxfire to escape and instantly return to you.

When you invest your Foxfire into a formcage foxfire lantern, you also choose either your true kitsune form or all of your alternate forms and invest those forms into the lantern. While your alternate forms are invested into a formcage foxfire lantern, you revert to your true form and cannot Change Shape. While your true kitusne form is invested into a formcage foxfire lantern, you assume one of your alternate forms and revert into your true form, even by effects that would normally force you to revert to this form. While invested with Foxfire, you can activate the lantern to change your appearance.

Activate 1 envision (concentrate, divine, polymorph, transmutation)

Requirements The veiled foxfire lantern is producing light as a light cantrip

Frequency once per day

Effect The creature holding the lantern Impersonates one of the forms invested into the formcage foxfire lantern. Use your Deception bonus or +20 when Impersonating this form, whichever is higher.

Activate 1 envision (concentrate, divine, evocation)

Effect The foxfire ember ignites into a cheery flame identical to that of the invested creature's Foxfire, shedding light as a @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Light} cantrip, heightened to half the invested character's level. Additionally, anyone holding the item gains a foxfire unarmed attack, as the Foxfire kitsune ancestry feat, as well as the benefits of all ancestry feats the invested character has that list Foxfire or Foxfire Adept Dedication as a prerequisite that are of a level equal to your level or the invested character's level, whichever is lower. You can use the hand that you're using to hold the foxfire lantern to Strike with this foxfire unarmed strike.

Foxfire Lantern (Veiled).name: Foxfire Lantern (Veiled)
Foxfire Lantern (Veiled).description:
Requirements Foxfire

Available in a multitude of styles, a foxfire lantern is a tool for storing a kitsune's foxfire. While Invested, an ember of your foxfire smolders within the foxfire lantern, producing dim light in a 5-foot area. Your investiture ends when a creature uses a single action to Interact with the foxfire lantern, opening it and allowing your foxfire to escape and instantly return to you.

While invested with Foxfire, you can activate the lantern to create an illusory scene.

Activate 1 envision (concentrate, divine, illusion)

Requirements The veiled foxfire lantern is producing light as a light cantrip

Frequency once per day

Effect Any scenery within the radius of the lantern's light, including creatures and objects, adjusts as you envision, functioning as a @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Ucf8eynbZMfUucjE]{Illusory Scene} divine spell with a spell level equal to half the invested character's level (minimum 6th level). This illusion is centered on the lantern and moves with the lantern and whomever is holding it. You can overlay illusions atop creatures that enter the scene, effectively placing a 3rd-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.i35dpZFI7jZcRoBo]{Illusory Disguise} effect on them. Anything that moves or is moved outside of the lantern's light resumes its usual appearance.

Activate 1 envision (concentrate, divine, evocation)

Effect The foxfire ember ignites into a cheery flame identical to that of the invested creature's Foxfire, shedding light as a @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Light} cantrip, heightened to half the invested character's level. Additionally, anyone holding the item gains a foxfire unarmed attack, as the Foxfire kitsune ancestry feat, as well as the benefits of all ancestry feats the invested character has that list Foxfire or Foxfire Adept Dedication as a prerequisite that are of a level equal to your level or the invested character's level, whichever is lower. You can use the hand that you're using to hold the foxfire lantern to Strike with this foxfire unarmed strike.

Kyubi Foxbrew.name: Kyubi Foxbrew
Kyubi Foxbrew.description:
Activate 1 interact

This delightful brew shimmers with an appetizing gold glow; both teas and rice wines traditionally include herbs that were magically cultivated by druids, granting them latent magical properties. You regain 1 Focus Point. [[/r 2d4+1 #Hours]]{2d4+1 hours} later or after you spend the focus point, you are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Stupefied]{Stupefied 2} for [[/r 2d4+1 #Hours]]{2d4+1 hours}. If you drink multiple kyubi foxbrews during this [[/r 2d4+1 #Hours]]{2d4+1 hours} period, you are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Drained]{Drained 2} and sickened with a condition value equal to the number of kyubi foxbrews you've consumed in the past 8 hours. You can Retch (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:20] save).

Mischievous Foxbrew.name: Mischievous Foxbrew
Mischievous Foxbrew.description:
Activate 1 interact

This brew sends tingles across the tongues of drinkers, filling them with manic energy; teas traditionally blend caffeinated herbs while rice wine is typically mixed with strong liquor, raising its alcohol content. For [[/r 2d4+1 #Hours]]{2d4+1 hours}, you gain a +2 status bonus to Acrobatics, Athletics, and Thievery checks as well as a -2 status penalty to Perception checks and checks to Recall Knowledge. You also gain a +5-foot status bonus to your Speeds. When the effect ends, you are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Stupefied]{Stupefied 2} for [[/r 2d4+1 #Hours]]{2d4+1 hours} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Fatigued]{Fatigued}.

Noh Mask of Ancestral Shapes (Artisan Hu.name: Noh Mask of Ancestral Shapes (Artisan Humanoid)
Noh Mask of Ancestral Shapes (Artisan Hu.description:
Carved from wood and available in a wide array of different colors and styles, each noh mask of ancestral shapes evokes the likeness of a specific ancestry, such as a human or elf.

The mask's tailless form is a single Small or Medium humanoid ancestry. You also gain a heritage from the mask's ancestry when using Change Shape to assume its tailless form.

Activate f envision

Frequency once per round

Effect If you Change Shape before the end of your turn, you assume the tailless form associated with your noh mask. This shape lasts until you use Change Shape again to assume your true form and uses the same rules as a kitsune's tailless form, except you exchange your size and Speed for those of that ancestry. You gain any special abilities that members of the heritage have (such as a lizardfolk's claws).

Noh Mask of Ancestral Shapes (Artisan Le.name: Noh Mask of Ancestral Shapes (Artisan Leshy)
Noh Mask of Ancestral Shapes (Artisan Le.description:
Carved from wood and available in a wide array of different colors and styles, each noh mask of ancestral shapes evokes the likeness of a specific ancestry, such as a human or elf.

The mask's tailless form is a Small plant. You gain the plant trait and the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.kpn4R65YlD38iAIS]{Ritual Reversion} ancestry feat while assuming this form. You also gain a heritage from the mask's ancestry when using Change Shape to assume its tailless form.

Activate f envision

Frequency once per round

Effect If you Change Shape before the end of your turn, you assume the tailless form associated with your noh mask. This shape lasts until you use Change Shape again to assume your true form and uses the same rules as a kitsune's tailless form, except you exchange your size and Speed for those of that ancestry. You gain any special abilities that members of the heritage have (such as a lizardfolk's claws).

Noh Mask of Ancestral Shapes (Artisan Po.name: Noh Mask of Ancestral Shapes (Artisan Poppet)
Noh Mask of Ancestral Shapes (Artisan Po.description:
Carved from wood and available in a wide array of different colors and styles, each noh mask of ancestral shapes evokes the likeness of a specific ancestry, such as a human or elf.

The mask's tailless form is a Tiny or Small construct. You gain the construct trait and the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.IAXWdFXwjFChojeb]{Harmless Doll} ancestry feat while assuming this form, but you don't gain the trained proficiency rank in Deception from the Harmless Doll feat. You also gain a heritage from the mask's ancestry when using Change Shape to assume its tailless form.

Activate f envision

Frequency once per round

Effect If you Change Shape before the end of your turn, you assume the tailless form associated with your noh mask. This shape lasts until you use Change Shape again to assume your true form and uses the same rules as a kitsune's tailless form, except you exchange your size and Speed for those of that ancestry. You gain any special abilities that members of the heritage have (such as a lizardfolk's claws).

Noh Mask of Ancestral Shapes (Humanoid).name: Noh Mask of Ancestral Shapes (Humanoid)
Noh Mask of Ancestral Shapes (Humanoid).description:
Carved from wood and available in a wide array of different colors and styles, each noh mask of ancestral shapes evokes the likeness of a specific ancestry, such as a human or elf.

The mask's tailless form is a single Small or Medium humanoid ancestry.

Activate f envision

Frequency once per round

Effect If you Change Shape before the end of your turn, you assume the tailless form associated with your noh mask. This shape lasts until you use Change Shape again to assume your true form and uses the same rules as a kitsune's tailless form, except you exchange your size and Speed for those of that ancestry. You gain any special abilities that members of the heritage have (such as a lizardfolk's claws).

Noh Mask of Ancestral Shapes (Leshy).name: Noh Mask of Ancestral Shapes (Leshy)
Noh Mask of Ancestral Shapes (Leshy).description:
Carved from wood and available in a wide array of different colors and styles, each noh mask of ancestral shapes evokes the likeness of a specific ancestry, such as a human or elf.

The mask's tailless form is a Small plant. You gain the plant trait and the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.kpn4R65YlD38iAIS]{Ritual Reversion} ancestry feat while assuming this form.

Activate f envision

Frequency once per round

Effect If you Change Shape before the end of your turn, you assume the tailless form associated with your noh mask. This shape lasts until you use Change Shape again to assume your true form and uses the same rules as a kitsune's tailless form, except you exchange your size and Speed for those of that ancestry. You gain any special abilities that members of the heritage have (such as a lizardfolk's claws).

Noh Mask of Ancestral Shapes (Poppet).name: Noh Mask of Ancestral Shapes (Poppet)
Noh Mask of Ancestral Shapes (Poppet).description:
Carved from wood and available in a wide array of different colors and styles, each noh mask of ancestral shapes evokes the likeness of a specific ancestry, such as a human or elf.

The mask's tailless form is a Tiny or Small construct. You gain the construct trait and the @Compendium[pf2e.feats-srd.IAXWdFXwjFChojeb]{Harmless Doll} ancestry feat while assuming this form, but you don't gain the trained proficiency rank in Deception from the Harmless Doll feat.

Activate f envision

Frequency once per round

Effect If you Change Shape before the end of your turn, you assume the tailless form associated with your noh mask. This shape lasts until you use Change Shape again to assume your true form and uses the same rules as a kitsune's tailless form, except you exchange your size and Speed for those of that ancestry. You gain any special abilities that members of the heritage have (such as a lizardfolk's claws).

Noh Mask of Animal Shapes (Greater).name: Noh Mask of Animal Shapes (Greater)
Noh Mask of Animal Shapes (Greater).description:
Whittled from a single piece of wood and meticulously painted, each noh mask of animal shapes has a stylized depiction of a specific animal, such as a fox or a bison.

Activate 1 envision

Frequency once per round

Effect If you Change Shape before the end of your turn, you assume the animal form associated with your noh mask. This shape lasts until you use Change Shape again to assume your true form. An animal form is an animal whose size is determined by the noh mask of animal shapes. You gain the animal trait plus any natural weapons, Speeds, or other abilities noted by the noh mask of animal shapes. All natural weapons granted deal 1d4 damage, are in the brawling group, and have the agile, finesse, and unarmed traits. You can't use weapons while in animal form, nor can you use shields or other held items of any sort, and you cannot take manipulate actions except to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Cast a Spell]{Cast a Spell} with somatic components or use simple Interact actions. Your animal form can't perform actions that require fingers, hands, or significant manual dexterity, including any action that would require a check to accomplish, unless that noh mask provides your animal form with prehensility. When you assume your animal form, your gear is absorbed into you; the constant abilities of your gear still function, but you can't activate any items.

The mask's animal form is a Tiny, Small, Medium, or Large animal. You gain the animal trait, a claw, hoof, horn, or jaws Strike, a Speed of 25 feet, and two abilities from the following list: a 10-foot status bonus to the form's Speed, climb Speed 25 feet, fly Speed 25 feet, swim Speed 25 feet, an additional Strike from the list above, low-light vision, or imprecise scent with a range of 30 feet. These abilities are chosen when the mask is created and cannot be changed. A noh mask of animal shapes cannot grant a special ability that its depicted animal does not have, at the GM's discretion.

Noh Mask of Animal Shapes (Lesser).name: Noh Mask of Animal Shapes (Lesser)
Noh Mask of Animal Shapes (Lesser).description:
Whittled from a single piece of wood and meticulously painted, each noh mask of animal shapes has a stylized depiction of a specific animal, such as a fox or a bison.

Activate 1 envision

Frequency once per round

Effect If you Change Shape before the end of your turn, you assume the animal form associated with your noh mask. This shape lasts until you use Change Shape again to assume your true form. An animal form is an animal whose size is determined by the noh mask of animal shapes. You gain the animal trait plus any natural weapons, Speeds, or other abilities noted by the noh mask of animal shapes. All natural weapons granted deal 1d4 damage, are in the brawling group, and have the agile, finesse, and unarmed traits. You can't use weapons while in animal form, nor can you use shields or other held items of any sort, and you cannot take manipulate actions except to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Cast a Spell]{Cast a Spell} with somatic components or use simple Interact actions. Your animal form can't perform actions that require fingers, hands, or significant manual dexterity, including any action that would require a check to accomplish, unless that noh mask provides your animal form with prehensility. When you assume your animal form, your gear is absorbed into you; the constant abilities of your gear still function, but you can't activate any items.

The mask's animal form is a Tiny animal. You gain the animal trait, a claw, hoof, horn, or jaws Strike, a Speed of 25 feet, and one abilities from the following list: a 10-foot status bonus to the form's Speed, climb Speed 25 feet, fly Speed 25 feet, swim Speed 25 feet, an additional Strike from the list above, low-light vision, or imprecise scent with a range of 30 feet. These abilities are chosen when the mask is created and cannot be changed. A noh mask of animal shapes cannot grant a special ability that its depicted animal does not have, at the GM's discretion.

Noh Mask of Animal Shapes (Megafauna).name: Noh Mask of Animal Shapes (Megafauna)
Noh Mask of Animal Shapes (Megafauna).description:
Whittled from a single piece of wood and meticulously painted, each noh mask of animal shapes has a stylized depiction of a specific animal, such as a fox or a bison.

Activate 1 envision

Frequency once per round

Effect If you Change Shape before the end of your turn, you assume the animal form associated with your noh mask. This shape lasts until you use Change Shape again to assume your true form. An animal form is an animal whose size is determined by the noh mask of animal shapes. You gain the animal trait plus any natural weapons, Speeds, or other abilities noted by the noh mask of animal shapes. All natural weapons granted deal 1d4 damage, are in the brawling group, and have the agile, finesse, and unarmed traits. You can't use weapons while in animal form, nor can you use shields or other held items of any sort, and you cannot take manipulate actions except to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Cast a Spell]{Cast a Spell} with somatic components or use simple Interact actions. Your animal form can't perform actions that require fingers, hands, or significant manual dexterity, including any action that would require a check to accomplish, unless that noh mask provides your animal form with prehensility. When you assume your animal form, your gear is absorbed into you; the constant abilities of your gear still function, but you can't activate any items.

The mask's animal form is a Gargantuan animal. You gain the animal trait, a claw, hoof, horn, or jaws Strike, a Speed of 25 feet, and four abilities from the following list: a 10-foot status bonus to the form's Speed, climb Speed 25 feet, fly Speed 25 feet, swim Speed 25 feet, an additional Strike from the list above, low-light vision, imprecise scent with a range of 30 feet, Buck, Constrict, darkvision, Ferocity, Grab, Knockdown, Rend (claws only), or Trample. You can replace your Strike's agile and finesse traits with two of the following weapon traits: deadly 1d6, grapple, forceful, reach 25, shove, sweep, or trip. These abilities are chosen when the mask is created and cannot be changed. A noh mask of animal shapes cannot grant a special ability that its depicted animal does not have, at the GM's discretion.

Noh Mask of Animal Shapes (Mighty).name: Noh Mask of Animal Shapes (Mighty)
Noh Mask of Animal Shapes (Mighty).description:
Whittled from a single piece of wood and meticulously painted, each noh mask of animal shapes has a stylized depiction of a specific animal, such as a fox or a bison.

Activate 1 envision

Frequency once per round

Effect If you Change Shape before the end of your turn, you assume the animal form associated with your noh mask. This shape lasts until you use Change Shape again to assume your true form. An animal form is an animal whose size is determined by the noh mask of animal shapes. You gain the animal trait plus any natural weapons, Speeds, or other abilities noted by the noh mask of animal shapes. All natural weapons granted deal 1d4 damage, are in the brawling group, and have the agile, finesse, and unarmed traits. You can't use weapons while in animal form, nor can you use shields or other held items of any sort, and you cannot take manipulate actions except to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Cast a Spell]{Cast a Spell} with somatic components or use simple Interact actions. Your animal form can't perform actions that require fingers, hands, or significant manual dexterity, including any action that would require a check to accomplish, unless that noh mask provides your animal form with prehensility. When you assume your animal form, your gear is absorbed into you; the constant abilities of your gear still function, but you can't activate any items.

The mask's animal form is a Tiny, Small, Medium, or Large animal. You gain the animal trait, a claw, hoof, horn, or jaws Strike, a Speed of 25 feet, and four abilities from the following list: a 10-foot status bonus to the form's Speed, climb Speed 25 feet, fly Speed 25 feet, swim Speed 25 feet, an additional Strike from the list above, low-light vision, imprecise scent with a range of 30 feet, Buck, Constrict, darkvision, Ferocity, Grab, Knockdown, Rend (claws only), or Trample. You can replace your Strike's agile and finesse traits with two of the following weapon traits: deadly 1d6, grapple, forceful, reach 10 feet (15 feet if Large), shove, sweep, or trip. These abilities are chosen when the mask is created and cannot be changed. A noh mask of animal shapes cannot grant a special ability that its depicted animal does not have, at the GM's discretion.

Noh Mask of Animal Shapes (Powerful).name: Noh Mask of Animal Shapes (Powerful)
Noh Mask of Animal Shapes (Powerful).description:
Whittled from a single piece of wood and meticulously painted, each noh mask of animal shapes has a stylized depiction of a specific animal, such as a fox or a bison.

Activate 1 envision

Frequency once per round

Effect If you Change Shape before the end of your turn, you assume the animal form associated with your noh mask. This shape lasts until you use Change Shape again to assume your true form. An animal form is an animal whose size is determined by the noh mask of animal shapes. You gain the animal trait plus any natural weapons, Speeds, or other abilities noted by the noh mask of animal shapes. All natural weapons granted deal 1d4 damage, are in the brawling group, and have the agile, finesse, and unarmed traits. You can't use weapons while in animal form, nor can you use shields or other held items of any sort, and you cannot take manipulate actions except to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Cast a Spell]{Cast a Spell} with somatic components or use simple Interact actions. Your animal form can't perform actions that require fingers, hands, or significant manual dexterity, including any action that would require a check to accomplish, unless that noh mask provides your animal form with prehensility. When you assume your animal form, your gear is absorbed into you; the constant abilities of your gear still function, but you can't activate any items.

The mask's animal form is a Huge animal. You gain the animal trait, a claw, hoof, horn, or jaws Strike, a Speed of 25 feet, and four abilities from the following list: a 10-foot status bonus to the form's Speed, climb Speed 25 feet, fly Speed 25 feet, swim Speed 25 feet, an additional Strike from the list above, low-light vision, imprecise scent with a range of 30 feet, Buck, Constrict, darkvision, Ferocity, Grab, Knockdown, Rend (claws only), or Trample. You can replace your Strike's agile and finesse traits with two of the following weapon traits: deadly 1d6, grapple, forceful, reach 20 feet, shove, sweep, or trip. These abilities are chosen when the mask is created and cannot be changed. A noh mask of animal shapes cannot grant a special ability that its depicted animal does not have, at the GM's discretion.

Noh Mask of Animal Shapes (Standard).name: Noh Mask of Animal Shapes (Standard)
Noh Mask of Animal Shapes (Standard).description:
Whittled from a single piece of wood and meticulously painted, each noh mask of animal shapes has a stylized depiction of a specific animal, such as a fox or a bison.

Activate 1 envision

Frequency once per round

Effect If you Change Shape before the end of your turn, you assume the animal form associated with your noh mask. This shape lasts until you use Change Shape again to assume your true form. An animal form is an animal whose size is determined by the noh mask of animal shapes. You gain the animal trait plus any natural weapons, Speeds, or other abilities noted by the noh mask of animal shapes. All natural weapons granted deal 1d4 damage, are in the brawling group, and have the agile, finesse, and unarmed traits. You can't use weapons while in animal form, nor can you use shields or other held items of any sort, and you cannot take manipulate actions except to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Cast a Spell]{Cast a Spell} with somatic components or use simple Interact actions. Your animal form can't perform actions that require fingers, hands, or significant manual dexterity, including any action that would require a check to accomplish, unless that noh mask provides your animal form with prehensility. When you assume your animal form, your gear is absorbed into you; the constant abilities of your gear still function, but you can't activate any items.

The mask's animal form is a Tiny, Small, or Medium animal. You gain the animal trait, a claw, hoof, horn, or jaws Strike, a Speed of 25 feet, and one abilities from the following list: a 10-foot status bonus to the form's Speed, climb Speed 25 feet, fly Speed 25 feet, swim Speed 25 feet, an additional Strike from the list above, low-light vision, or imprecise scent with a range of 30 feet. These abilities are chosen when the mask is created and cannot be changed. A noh mask of animal shapes cannot grant a special ability that its depicted animal does not have, at the GM's discretion.

Noh Mask of Draconic Shapes (Grand Imper.name: Noh Mask of Draconic Shapes (Grand Imperial)
Noh Mask of Draconic Shapes (Grand Imper.description:
Wrought from wood harvested from a century-old tree, each noh mask of draconic shapes depicts a type of dragon.

Activate 1 envision

Frequency once per round

Effect If you Change Shape before the end of your turn, you assume the dragon form associated with your noh mask. This shape lasts until you use Change Shape again to assume your true form. A dragon form is a dragon whose size is determined by the noh mask of draconic shapes. You gain the dragon trait, a jaws Strike that deals [[/r {1d4}[piercing]]]{1d4 piercing damage}, a claws Strike that deals [[/r {1d4}[slashing]]]{1d4 slashing damage}, a tail Strike that deals bludgeoning damage, darkvision, a Speed of 20 feet and a fly Speed of 35 feet, a breath weapon usable once every [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, and one or more abilities noted by the mask. All natural weapons are in the brawling group and have the unarmed trait. When you assume your dragon form, your gear is absorbed into you; the constant abilities of your gear still function, but you can't activate any items.

The mask's dragon form is a Gargantuan imperial dragon. Your breath weapon requires two actions, is either a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] targeting an area within 60 feet or a @Template[type:cone|distance:30], and deals [[/r (@actor.level)d6]]{1d6 damage per level} you possess; the breath weapon's damage type and whether it is a burst or a cone is the same as the type of imperial dragon that the mask is based on. Your jaws and tail have the reach trait, and your claws have the agile trait

Noh Mask of Draconic Shapes (Greater Imp.name: Noh Mask of Draconic Shapes (Greater Imperial)
Noh Mask of Draconic Shapes (Greater Imp.description:
Wrought from wood harvested from a century-old tree, each noh mask of draconic shapes depicts a type of dragon.

Activate 1 envision

Frequency once per round

Effect If you Change Shape before the end of your turn, you assume the dragon form associated with your noh mask. This shape lasts until you use Change Shape again to assume your true form. A dragon form is a dragon whose size is determined by the noh mask of draconic shapes. You gain the dragon trait, a jaws Strike that deals [[/r {1d4}[piercing]]]{1d4 piercing damage}, a claws Strike that deals [[/r {1d4}[slashing]]]{1d4 slashing damage}, a tail Strike that deals bludgeoning damage, darkvision, a Speed of 20 feet and a fly Speed of 35 feet, a breath weapon usable once every [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, and one or more abilities noted by the mask. All natural weapons are in the brawling group and have the unarmed trait. When you assume your dragon form, your gear is absorbed into you; the constant abilities of your gear still function, but you can't activate any items.

The mask's dragon form is a Huge imperial dragon. Your breath weapon requires two actions, is either a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] targeting an area within 60 feet or a @Template[type:cone|distance:30], and deals [[/r (@actor.level)d6]]{1d6 damage per level} you possess; the breath weapon's damage type and whether it is a burst or a cone is the same as the type of imperial dragon that the mask is based on. Your jaws and tail have the reach trait, and your claws have the agile trait

Noh Mask of Draconic Shapes (Lesser Impe.name: Noh Mask of Draconic Shapes (Lesser Imperial)
Noh Mask of Draconic Shapes (Lesser Impe.description:
Wrought from wood harvested from a century-old tree, each noh mask of draconic shapes depicts a type of dragon.

Activate 1 envision

Frequency once per round

Effect If you Change Shape before the end of your turn, you assume the dragon form associated with your noh mask. This shape lasts until you use Change Shape again to assume your true form. A dragon form is a dragon whose size is determined by the noh mask of draconic shapes. You gain the dragon trait, a jaws Strike that deals [[/r {1d4}[piercing]]]{1d4 piercing damage}, a claws Strike that deals [[/r {1d4}[slashing]]]{1d4 slashing damage}, a tail Strike that deals bludgeoning damage, darkvision, a Speed of 20 feet and a fly Speed of 35 feet, a breath weapon usable once every [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, and one or more abilities noted by the mask. All natural weapons are in the brawling group and have the unarmed trait. When you assume your dragon form, your gear is absorbed into you; the constant abilities of your gear still function, but you can't activate any items.

The mask's dragon form is a Large imperial dragon. Your breath weapon requires two actions, is either a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] targeting an area within 60 feet or a @Template[type:cone|distance:30], and deals [[/r (@actor.level)d6]]{1d6 damage per level} you possess; the breath weapon's damage type and whether it is a burst or a cone is the same as the type of imperial dragon that the mask is based on.

Noh Mask of the Gumiho.name: Noh Mask of the Gumiho
Noh Mask of the Gumiho.description:
Painted on a canvas of carved, fey-touched wood using otherworldly hues and animal blood, each noh mask of the gumiho is wrought in the likeness of a nine-tailed fox.

Activate 1 envision

Frequency once per round

Effect If you Change Shape before the end of your turn, you assume a gumiho form. This shape lasts until you use Change Shape again to assume your true form. A gumiho form is a Medium fey. You gain the fey trait, a jaws Strike that deals [[/r {1d4}[piercing]]]{1d4 piercing damage}, a claws Strike that deals [[/r {1d4}[slashing]]]{1d4 slashing damage}, a Speed of 40 feet, and a +4 item bonus to Deception and Diplomacy checks. When you Strike with your claws or jaws and critically succeed, you regain Hit Points equal to your level.

Noh Mask of the Nogitsune.name: Noh Mask of the Nogitsune
Noh Mask of the Nogitsune.description:
Carved from blood-fed wood to resemble an oni clad in kitsune flesh, each noh mask of the nogitsune is a wooden, stylized depiction of the visage of a nogitsune oni.

Activate 1 envision

Frequency once per round

Effect If you Change Shape before the end of your turn, you assume a nogitsune form. This shape lasts until you use Change Shape again to assume your true form. A nogitsune form is a Medium fiend. You gain the fiend trait, a jaws Strike that deals piercing damage, a claws Strike that deals [[/r {1d4}[slashing]]]{1d4 slashing damage}, a ranged foxfire Strike that deals [[/r {1d4}[fire]]]{1d4 fire damage} and has a range of 20 feet (no range increment), a Speed of 35 feet, and fast healing 1. Once per day, you can spend two actions to increase your fast healing to half your level for 1 minute.

Noh Mask of the Pipefox.name: Noh Mask of the Pipefox
Noh Mask of the Pipefox.description:
Shaped to resemble a pipefox, each noh mask of the pipefox resembles a inquisitive, limbless fox.

Activate 1 envision

Frequency once per round

Effect If you Change Shape before the end of your turn, you assume a pipefox form. This shape lasts until you use Change Shape again to assume your true form. A pipefox form is a Tiny beast. You gain the beast trait, a jaws natural weapon that deals [[/r {1d4}[piercing]]]{1d4 piercing damage} and has the agile, finesse, and unarmed traits, a Speed of 25 feet, a climb Speed of 25 feet, darkvision, and the Multilingual skill feat. You can't use weapons while in pipefox form, nor can you use shields or other held items of any sort, and you cannot take manipulate actions except to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Cast a Spell]{Cast a Spell} or use simple Interact actions. Your pipefox form can't perform actions that require fingers, hands, or significant manual dexterity, including any action that would require a check to accomplish.

Noh Mask of the Vulpinal.name: Noh Mask of the Vulpinal
Noh Mask of the Vulpinal.description:
Fancifully painted to resemble a celestial fox, each noh mask of the vulpinal is a wooden, stylized depiction of the visage of a vulpinal agathion.

Activate 1 interact

Frequency once per day

Requirements You are assuming a vulpinal form;

Effect You gain 1 Focus Point and immediately use the Focus Point to cast the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.zNN9212H2FGfM7VS]{Lay on Hands} devotion spell. You can use this activation to cast this spell even if you don't have the devotion spells class feature.

Activate 1 envision

Frequency once per round

Effect If you Change Shape before the end of your turn, you assume a vulpinal form. This shape lasts until you use Change Shape again to assume your true form. A vulpinal form is a Small celestial. You gain the celestial trait, a jaws Strike that deals piercing damage, a claws Strike that deals slashing damage, a Speed of 30 feet, speak with animals as a constant spell-like ability, and the ability to cast the lay on hands focus spell. Once per round at the start of your turn, you can Recall Knowledge as a free action.

Rejuvinating Foxbrew.name: Rejuvinating Foxbrew
Rejuvinating Foxbrew.description:
Activate 1 interact

This aromatic brew is typically sweet and tastes of freshly-bloomed flowers; teas traditionally blend blackberry leaves with ginseng and honey while rice wine is infused with blackberry juice. 10 minutes after the tea is consumed, the drinker gains the following action for the next hour. After the hour or the action's effects pass (whichever is longer), you are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Stupefied]{Stupefied 2} for [[/r 2d4+1 #Hours]]{2d4+1 hours} as the foxbrew renders you immature.

Reminisce 1

Effect You reminisce about your younger years and your body (but not your mind) changes to match. Your age changes to match however old you were during the memory you envisioned, reducing your size, Speed, and reach as appropriate for a member of your ancestry at this age. If you become younger than an adolescent of your species, you gain weakness 5 to physical damage. This effect lasts until the brew has been fully digested (typically [[/r 2d4+1 #Hours]]{2d4+1 hours}). Additional doses can extend the effect, but for each additional dose you imbibe within 24 hours, you must succeed at a flat check (DC 0 + the number of doses you've have in the past 24 hours) or the brew's effects make you younger than you anticipated and cause your memory, cognitive abilities, and personality to match your younger age for the duration of Reminisce's effect.

Tinglewell Foxbrew.name: Tinglewell Foxbrew
Tinglewell Foxbrew.description:
Activate 1 interact

This nonsensically named foxbrew causes waves of pleasurable sensations to wash over the drinker's body, relaxing muscles and improving blood flow; teas blend black and green herbs with ginseng while rice wine is typically mixed with fermented cereal grains. For [[/r 2d4+1 #Hours]]{2d4+1 hours}, you become immune to pain effects and gain resistance 5 against physical damage, but you also take a -2 status penalty to Acrobatics, Athletics, Thievery, and Stealth checks, as well as a -2 status penalty to AC. When the effect ends, you fall asleep for [[/r 2d4+1 #Hours]]{2d4+1 hours}; if awoken, you're @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Fatigued]{Fatigued}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Enfeebled]{Enfeebled 2}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Stupefied]{Stupefied 2}, and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Slowed]{Slowed 1} until you sleep the remaining hours.

Wild Foxbrew.name: Wild Foxbrew
Wild Foxbrew.description:
Activate 1 interact

Brewed exclusively from wild berries and herbs, this brew has a primeval taste; teas blend wild berries with sweet leaves while rice wine is left to ferment inside hollowed trees, rather than using modern fermenting processes. Over the next 10 minutes after the tea is consumed, you transform into a random. Characters that are associated with animals, such as kitsune with foxes or animal totem barbarians, always become their associated animal. This otherwise functions as though you had used Change Shape to assume a lesser noh mask of animal shapes's animal form of Tiny, Small, or Medium size. This effect lasts 2d4+1 hours. When the effect ends, you are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Sickened]{Sickened 1} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Stupefied]{Stupefied 2} for 2d4+1 hours. Every [[/r 2d4 #rounds]]{2d4 rounds}, your sickened condition's value increases by 1; if you aren't sickened, you become sickened 1. You can Retch (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:20]) by making a sound associated with the animal form you assumed.
